info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 11:58PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hamilton and central Herkimer Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Steuben, or 7 miles south of Boonville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ohio, Newport, Poland, Cold Brook, Northwood, Russia, Norway, Nobleboro, Farrel Corner, Wilmurt Corners, Morehouseville, Hurricane, Old City, Grant, Gray, Black Creek Reservoir, Atwell, Wheelertown, Woodin Corners and Irish Settlement. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
